meanings.definition: The exclusive possession or control of the supply or trade in a commodity or service.
meanings.sent1: The monopoly over the lemonade stand made it the only place to buy drinks in the park.
meanings.sent2: The tech giant held a monopoly on smartphone production, dominating the market.
meanings.sent3: Having a monopoly on selling cookies at school made Sarah the cookie queen.
meanings.sent4: His monopoly on the fishing spot made him the envy of all the other anglers.
meanings.sent5: The monopoly on water sources in the desert gave the company immense power.

meanings.definition: A company or group having exclusive control over a commercial activity.
meanings.sent1: The local bakery was a monopoly in the town, attracting customers with its delicious pastries.
meanings.sent2: The oil company established a monopoly over fuel distribution in the region.
meanings.sent3: The monopoly on selling ice cream in winter seemed like a chilly business decision.
meanings.sent4: Her monopoly on flower delivery services blossomed into a successful venture.
meanings.sent5: The monopoly on toy production led to a lack of variety in the market.
